chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing

Goal:
forall x y : K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y

Premises:
abs = AbsRing.abs (Ring.Pack K (AbsRing.class K) K) (AbsRing.class K) : K -> R
plus = fun G : AbelianGroup => AbelianGroup.plus G (AbelianGroup.class G) : forall G : AbelianGroup, G -> G -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted
AbsRing.Mixin : forall (K : Ring) (abs : K -> R), abs zero = 0 -> abs (opp one) = 1 -> (forall x y : K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y) -> (forall x y : K, abs (mult x y) <= abs x * abs y) -> (forall x : K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero) -> AbsRing.mixin_of K
Record mixin_of (K : Ring) : Type := Mixin { abs : K -> R; ax1 : abs zero = 0; ax2 : abs (opp one) = 1; ax3 : forall x y : K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y; ax4 : forall x y : K, abs (mult x y) <= abs x * abs y; ax5 : forall x : K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope _ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope]
Ring.Mixin : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (mult : K -> K -> K) (one : K), (forall x y z : K, mult x (mult y z) = mult (mult x y) z) -> (forall x : K, mult x one = x) -> (forall x : K, mult one x = x) -> (forall x y z : K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z)) -> (forall x y z : K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z)) -> Ring.mixin_of K
Record mixin_of (K : AbelianGroup) : Type := Mixin { mult : K -> K -> K; one : AbelianGroup.sort K; ax1 : forall x y z : K, mult x (mult y z) = mult (mult x y) z; ax2 : forall x : K, mult x one = x; ax3 : forall x : K, mult one x = x; ax4 : forall x y z : K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z); ax5 : forall x y z : K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z) } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
plus_assoc : forall x y z : ?G, plus x (plus y z) = plus (plus x y) z where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
mult_distr_l : forall x y z : ?K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z) where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- Ring]
opp_plus : forall x y : ?G, opp (plus x y) = plus (opp x) (opp y) where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
mult_distr_r : forall x y z : ?K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z) where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- Ring]
AbsRing.ax3 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x y : K), AbsRing.abs K m (plus x y) <= AbsRing.abs K m x + AbsRing.abs K m y
abs_opp_one = AbsRing.ax2 K (AbsRing.class K) : abs (opp one) = 1
minus_trans : forall r x y : ?G, minus x y = plus (minus x r) (minus r y) where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
abs_zero = AbsRing.ax1 (Ring.Pack K (AbsRing.class K) K) (AbsRing.class K) : abs zero = 0
Ring.ax5 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m x (plus y z) = plus (Ring.mult K m x y) (Ring.mult K m x z)
R_dist_tri : forall x y z : R, R_dist x y <= R_dist x z + R_dist z y
Ring.ax4 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m (plus x y) z = plus (Ring.mult K m x z) (Ring.mult K m y z)
plus_comm : forall x y : ?G, plus x y = plus y x where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
Rmax_left : forall x y : R, y <= x -> Rmax x y = x
Rmax_right : forall x y : R, x <= y -> Rmax x y = y
Record Metric_Space : Type := Build_Metric_Space { Base : Type; dist : Base -> Base -> R; dist_pos : forall x y : Base, dist x y >= 0; dist_sym : forall x y : Base, dist x y = dist y x; dist_refl : forall x y : Base, dist x y = 0 < -> x = y; dist_tri : forall x y z : Base, dist x y <= dist x z + dist z y } For Build_Metric_Space: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
AbsRing.ax4 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x y : K), AbsRing.abs K m (mult x y) <= AbsRing.abs K m x * AbsRing.abs K m y
plus_reg_r : forall r x y : ?G, plus x r = plus y r -> x = y where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
plus_reg_l : forall r x y : ?G, plus r x = plus r y -> x = y where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
Rsqr_incr_0_var : forall x y : R, x² <= y² -> 0 <= y -> x <= y
Fourier_util.Rle_zero_pos_plus1 : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> 0 <= 1 + x
iter_nat_Chasles : forall (op : ?T -> ?T -> ?T) (x0 : ?T), (forall x : ?T, op x0 x = x) -> (forall x y z : ?T, op x (op y z) = op (op x y) z) -> forall (a : nat -> ?T) (n m k : nat), (n <= S m)%nat -> (m <= k)%nat -> iter_nat op x0 a n k = op (iter_nat op x0 a n m) (iter_nat op x0 a (S m) k) where ?T : [K : AbsRing |- Type]
AbelianGroup.ax2 : forall (G : Type) (m : AbelianGroup.mixin_of G) (x y z : G), AbelianGroup.plus G m x (AbelianGroup.plus G m y z) = AbelianGroup.plus G m (AbelianGroup.plus G m x y) z
Ring.ax1 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m x (Ring.mult K m y z) = Ring.mult K m (Ring.mult K m x y) z
plus_zero_l : forall x : ?G, plus zero x = x where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
plus_zero_r : forall x : ?G, plus x zero = x where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
nfloor1_ex : forall x : R, 0 < x -> {n : nat | INR n < x <= INR n + 1}
